newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Triumph reports Q1 result, sees div payment.
newsitem.headline: Triumph reports Q1 result, sees div payment.

text.p: Triumph Industries on Friday reported an unaudited pre-tax profit of NZ$725,000 for the first quarter ended March 31, 1997.
Triumph said a continuation of this level of profitability would see the reinstatement of a dividend later in the year.

"While the groups' balance sheet needs to be strengthened, which we anticipate occurring through asset reduction, we remain committed to paying out a high proportion of our profits as dividends," Triumph said in a statement.
Managing Director Trevor Grey said the results reflected the new direction the company was taking in 1997. The company is a a computer distributor.
"We have undergone significant rationalisation over the last few months, completing asset sales for the Auckland branch of CDL Systems and Triumph Sheetmetals," he said.
